skillTree.localised_description: Enables the Terrorgheist Mount

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit is Undead (does not rout, immune to terror, becomes unstable when Leadership is low).

skillTree.localised_description: When a Mourngul Lord gathers his fleet, the hideous and stinking corpses of the most feared creatures of the sea swim along their ships

effects.description:
Leadership +4% for all Monster units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership +8% for all Monster units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The mere vision of the ragged sails and worn ships of a Mourngul Lord´s fleet on the horizon is more than enough for entire cities to fall into a blind state of panic

effects.description:
Income from all enemy buildings: -5%
	(local enemy province)

skillTree.localised_description: The thirst of this vampire is unquencheable and he will never stop pursuing his prey
On land and sea, Strigoi will attract and give unlife and strength to the most reviled creatures of the world, those that devour the flesh of mortals until they themselves are corrupted by Dark Magic

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +4% for Mournguls units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +8% for Mournguls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Other Vampire Captains search corpses of the greatest see monsters to reanimate and use them. An Strigoi hunts the living ones and kills them himself

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +2 for Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
"See my coat of crimson armour? It is strengthened by thine blood and fear."
"Look into mine eyes, mortal; what glories do you see?"
The sword-strikes of mortal man are but clumsy, childish lunges before the preternatural speed of a Vampire.
Strike hard, strike true.
The strength of this Vampire to endure the centuries is beyond compare.
To look upon this Undead Lord is to witness true and absolute horror!

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)

ui_effects.localised_text: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: This adept uses the Winds of Magic to seek out arcane artefacts.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Bone, muscle and sinew cannot always be relied upon to hold together unassisted.

skillTree.localised_description: "Listen very carefully, me hearties, I shall say this only once… Quiet! Stromfels' stinkin' breath!"
The once-men of the Undead legions march ever onwards, according to the will of their binder.

skillTree.localised_description: "Now listen up an' listen good… here be the plan…"
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
They could not break free, even if they wanted to.
Cursed to haunt the waves forever, never finding rest or solace.
If it's not tacked down, this one'll 'ave it and kill anyone who gets in their way.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: "You'll never find such a crew - villainous scum, the lot of 'em. I certainly wouldn't want to be facing 'em in the thick of battle!"

	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +4 when fighting at sea
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There's a time in every sailor's, er, life when the black flag seems like the best, if not the only option.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A simple glamour can disguise a monstrous Vampire or Liche, so they may then charm and beguile the local populace.
Such things keep the eternal players' of this world alive.
Take care of your ship and she will have a care for your wellbeing in return.
Beware those who sail under the black flag - they give no quarter and never, ever give up the chase.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit is Undead (does not rout, immune to terror, becomes unstable when Leadership is low).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Beautiful and innocent it may be, but all will be consumed by fire in the end. It is written.

effects.description: Gain loyalty from razing settlements and winning siege battles

backgroundSkills.localised_description: How else is an ordinary, decent pirate to make an honest living in these hard, dark times?

effects.description: Gain loyalty from sacking and raiding
Brute: Extra loyalty gained following a battle

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Killing is at the forefront of this one's mind. Hopefully, they also know how to run a ship.

effects.description: Gain loyalty from defeating enemy army and wounding/killing enemy Lords in battle
Brute: Extra loyalty gained following a battle

backgroundSkills.localised_description: It takes more than mere muscle to be leader, you must also know how to make money and how to inflict pain - a lot of pain.

effects.description: Gain loyalty from recruiting and fighting with other pirate Lords in battle
Mastermind: Loyalty decline rate is lowered

backgroundSkills.localised_description: There's nothing quite like a good, straightforward plan - and this is nothing like one! Complexity rarely trumps simplicity, in all matters.

effects.description: Gain loyalty from ambush and lightning-strike battles
Mastermind: Loyalty decline rate is lowered

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Be the cargo powder, steel, gold or flesh, in the final analysis it matters not.

effects.description: Gain loyalty from constructing pirate coves
